get the position and assign it a sign value from a str_locate_all output

get the position and assign it a sign value from a str_locate_all output

position_and_sign(.x, sign = "p")

Arguments

.x

list of start and end positions for locate call
sign

the sign value, (p/n)

Examples

 positives <- stringr::str_locate_all('-ka*Ad+F11*input1', '\\+')
 position_and_sign(positives)
#> Error in if (nrow(.x)) {    results <- c()    for (r in 1:nrow(.x)) {        results <- c(results, purrr::set_names(.x[r][[1]], sign))    }    return(results)}: argument is of length zero
